TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ConnectivityManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Class that answers queries about the state of network connectivity.

remarks.para: Class that answers queries about the state of network connectivity. It also notifies applications when network connectivity changes. Get an instance of this class by calling .

The primary responsibilities of this class are to:
Monitor network connections (Wi-Fi, GPRS, UMTS, etc.)
Send broadcast intents when network connectivity changes
Attempt to "fail over" to another network when connectivity to a network is lost
Provide an API that allows applications to query the coarse-grained or fine-grained state of the available networks
Provide an API that allows applications to request and select networks for their data traffic

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: The setting for background data usage has changed values.

remarks.para: Broadcast Action: The setting for background data usage has changed values. Use to get the current value.
If an application uses the network in the background, it should listen for this broadcast and stop using the background data if the value is false.

Docs.summary: Returns details about the currently active default data network.

remarks.para: Returns details about the currently active default data network. When connected, this network is the default route for outgoing connections. You should always check before initiating network traffic. This may return null when there is no default network.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddDefaultNetworkActiveListener(class Android.Net.ConnectivityManager/IOnNetworkActiveListener l) cil managed

Docs.param: The listener to be told when the network is active.
Docs.summary: Start listening to reports when the system's default data network is active, meaning it is a good time to perform network traffic.

remarks.para: Start listening to reports when the system's default data network is active, meaning it is a good time to perform network traffic. Use to determine the current state of the system's default network after registering the listener.
If the process default network has been set with this function will not reflect the process's default, but the system default.

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the setting for background data usage.

remarks.para: Returns the value of the setting for background data usage. If false, applications should not use the network if the application is not in the foreground. Developers should respect this setting, and check the value of this before performing any background data operations.
All applications that have background services that use the network should listen to .

Docs.summary: A change in network connectivity has occurred.

remarks.para: A change in network connectivity has occurred. A default connection has either been established or lost. The NetworkInfo for the affected network is sent as an extra; it should be consulted to see what kind of connectivity event occurred.
If this is a connection that was the result of failing over from a disconnected network, then the FAILOVER_CONNECTION boolean extra is set to true.

For a loss of connectivity, if the connectivity manager is attempting to connect (or has already connected) to another network, the NetworkInfo for the new network is also passed as an extra. This lets any receivers of the broadcast know that they should not necessarily tell the user that no data traffic will be possible. Instead, the receiver should expect another broadcast soon, indicating either that the failover attempt succeeded (and so there is still overall data connectivity), or that the failover attempt failed, meaning that all connectivity has been lost.
For a disconnect event, the boolean extra EXTRA_NO_CONNECTIVITY is set to true if there are no connected networks at all.

remarks.para: If you want to set the default network preference,you can directly change the networkAttributes array in framework's config.xml.

Docs.summary: The lookup key for a string that provides optionally supplied extra information about the network state.

remarks.para: The lookup key for a string that provides optionally supplied extra information about the network state. The information may be passed up from the lower networking layers, and its meaning may be specific to a particular network type. Retrieve it with .

Docs.summary: The lookup key for a boolean that indicates whether a connect event is for a network to which the connectivity manager was failing over following a disconnect on another network.

remarks.para: The lookup key for a boolean that indicates whether a connect event is for a network to which the connectivity manager was failing over following a disconnect on another network. Retrieve it with .

Docs.summary: The lookup key for a boolean that indicates whether there is a complete lack of connectivity, i.e., no network is available.

remarks.para: The lookup key for a boolean that indicates whether there is a complete lack of connectivity, i.e., no network is available. Retrieve it with .

Docs.summary: The lookup key for a object.

remarks.para: The lookup key for a object. This is supplied when there is another network that it may be possible to connect to. Retrieve with .

Docs.summary: The lookup key for a string that indicates why an attempt to connect to a network failed.

remarks.para: The lookup key for a string that indicates why an attempt to connect to a network failed. The string has no particular structure. It is intended to be used in notifications presented to users. Retrieve it with .

Docs.summary: Returns if the currently active data network is metered.

remarks.para: Returns if the currently active data network is metered. A network is classified as metered when the user is sensitive to heavy data usage on that connection due to monetary costs, data limitations or battery/performance issues. You should check this before doing large data transfers, and warn the user or delay the operation until another network is available.

Docs.summary: Return whether the data network is currently active.

remarks.para: Return whether the data network is currently active. An active network means that it is currently in a high power state for performing data transmission. On some types of networks, it may be expensive to move and stay in such a state, so it is more power efficient to batch network traffic together when the radio is already in this state. This method tells you whether right now is currently a good time to initiate network traffic, as the network is already active.

remarks.para: Report a problem network to the framework. This provides a hint to the system that there might be connectivity problems on this network and may cause the framework to re-evaluate network connectivity and/or switch to another network.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool SetProcessDefaultNetwork(class Android.Net.Network network) cil managed

Docs.param: The to bind the current process to, or null to clear the current binding.
Docs.summary: Binds the current process to network.

remarks.para: Binds the current process to network. All Sockets created in the future (and not explicitly bound via a bound SocketFactory from ) will be bound to network. All host name resolutions will be limited to network as well. Note that if network ever disconnects, all Sockets created in this way will cease to work and all host name resolutions will fail. This is by design so an application doesn't accidentally use Sockets it thinks are still bound to a particular . To clear binding pass null for network. Using individually bound Sockets created by Network.getSocketFactory().createSocket() and performing network-specific host name resolutions via is preferred to calling setProcessDefaultNetwork.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UnregisterNetworkCallback(class Android.Net.ConnectivityManager/NetworkCallback networkCallback) cil managed

Docs.param: The used when making the request.
Docs.summary: Unregisters callbacks about and possibly releases networks originating from and calls.

remarks.para: Unregisters callbacks about and possibly releases networks originating from and calls. If the given NetworkCallback had previosuly been used with #requestNetwork, any networks that had been connected to only to satisfy that request will be disconnected.
